messages: f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (02:50): waves from Australia
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (02:51): It's good to be back in a normal country with Vegemite, Cottees Cordial and Tim Tams :-)
b45082526d2f65fa02eee54f1a7995fc (02:55): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: ping
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:55): hi
b45082526d2f65fa02eee54f1a7995fc (02:55): Hey. I have a question about firing media events
b45082526d2f65fa02eee54f1a7995fc (02:56): the spec clearly says that some should fire synchronously, eg. "must synchronously fire a progress event called loadstart" (4.8.10.4)
b45082526d2f65fa02eee54f1a7995fc (02:56): and others are clearly asynchronous, eg. "must queue a task to fire a simple event called play" (4.8.10.7)
b45082526d2f65fa02eee54f1a7995fc (02:56): but the descriptions in the section on ready states (4.8.10.6) are somewhat ambiguous
b45082526d2f65fa02eee54f1a7995fc (02:56): eg. "and fire a simple event called play"
b45082526d2f65fa02eee54f1a7995fc (02:57): (even though "canshowcurrentframe" and "play" are explicitly asynchronous elsewhere)
b45082526d2f65fa02eee54f1a7995fc (02:57): so are the ready state change events fired differently from others?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:58): "fire a simple event" is synchronous, but that doesn't preclude an error in the spec :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:58): i should probably remove th word "synchronously" from the spec so that it doesn
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:58): 't confuse people when i omit it
b45082526d2f65fa02eee54f1a7995fc (02:59): OK, thanks.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:00): wait, hold on
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:00): it has to be asynchronous for those
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:00): there's nothing to be synchronous with
b45082526d2f65fa02eee54f1a7995fc (03:00): good, that's what I was about to argue.
b45082526d2f65fa02eee54f1a7995fc (03:00): now I don't need to bother  ;)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:01): i'll file a bug saying that these should be fixed to say that a task should be queued to fire the events
b45082526d2f65fa02eee54f1a7995fc (03:09): that was quick. thanks!
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (03:11): LOL, someone pretending to be 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e is posting spam to the whatwg blog :-)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (03:12): (unless 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e really was posting about eugenics and nazis, but I doubt it)

I'll leave that problem up to the PR folk to solve." -- ian hickson http://ln.hixie.ch/?start=1023585606&amp;count=1
